page.title: 05Changes in Our D-Block
page.content: Mr. Girling has lived in the same house for nearly 50 years. He remembers the houses on the main road being the only ones to have mains water, electricity and sewers. In 1936 there were very few cars but a good bus service and the road was covered in asphalt. Today there are few buses but very heavy car and lorry traffic which means the tarmac road is always being repaired. Behind the main road very little has changed. The same families farm the land, but the labourers were Irish, then Breton, now Portuguese. No tomatoes now, but more cereal is grown on the cotils. The few cows are now milked by machine.
